name: TheAtlantic
text: "Many of the behaviors that our elected representatives display regularly on Capitol Hill would get them scolded at best and marched out by security at worst if they held the same kinds of jobs as most of their constituents," writes @GrahamDavidA: https://t.co/Qq7auTwUpI

name: TheAtlantic
text: Michigan Representative Debbie Dingell was one of the few Democrats who saw Donald Trump coming. She’s worried her party will underestimate him again, she tells @elainejgodfrey: https://t.co/8nzJqNSea1

name: TheAtlantic
text: Voice acting has long been under scrutiny about race and representation. But the recent wave of white actors departing from roles that depict characters of color has delivered a shock to the industry, @shirklesxp reports. https://t.co/GsQc65FFai

name: TheAtlantic
text: Voice acting has long been under scrutiny about race and representation. But the recent wave of white actors departing from roles that depict characters of color has delivered a shock to the industry, shirklesxp reports. https://t.co/zLnwERYXKB

name: TheAtlantic
text: Sure, the creators of anti-racist reading lists mean well. But literature and dialogue cannot supplant restorative social policies and organizational change, @saigrundy writes: https://t.co/GYLIAYva0M

name: TheAtlantic
text: Photos: Paws in the Water—Dogs at Play, via @TheAtlPhoto: https://t.co/6QN6ILs8Vx

name: TheAtlantic
text:
"Raising awareness about racism is not a means in itself of correcting injustice."

@saigrundy on the deceptive passivity of the anti-racist reading list: https://t.co/RAjbvxPTVn

name: TheAtlantic
text: The science behind Randonautica is shaky at best, but some of the adventures are real, @kait_tiffany reports. How a random-coordinates generator became the app of the summer: https://t.co/QYHHpq4901

name: TheAtlantic
text: Two writers warn against treating even well-intended works as a cure-all. The latest Atlantic Daily: https://t.co/YP98YSrHFP

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: "When the president is bent on using executive power for purely political ends, the specifics of the executive-branch organizational chart do not matter."

Yet another smart piece from @juliettekayyem:
https://t.co/9jaYASaTkx

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @AdamHSays: "A century from now, when almost all of us are dead, if we don’t act with urgency and boldness, I can only imagine what our descendants will be saying about us."

Read @DrIbram: https://t.co/wmatMNiZrG

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @RonBrownstein: New data out this morning show that in every major American city—from the poorest to the richest—huge gaps in wages & educational attainment still separate white people and people of color, @RonBrownstein reports: https://t.co/2HicSWWO3T

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Welcome to the world of performative authoritarianism, a form of politics that reached new heights of sophistication in Russia over the past decade and has now arrived in the United States," @anneapplebaum writes: https://t.co/ZFafUUe2hc

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @mckaycoppins: Larry Hogan is betting his future on a kinder, gentler post-Trump GOP. Good luck with that. 

I spoke to the governor of Maryland about Trump, the pandemic, anti-racist protests, and the future of his party.   https://t.co/f7iWtiL5xz

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @anneapplebaum: Although the administration's actions in Portland make no sense as law enforcement, they make perfect sense as part of a new kind of political campaign: Welcome to the era of performative authoritarianism https://t.co/JFbuQwEaRb

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @TheAtlIdeas: "To be anti-racist is to believe in the word 'now.' 'Patience' is a dirty word to those incarcerated by inequity," @DrIbram writes: https://t.co/RJ4ykqS8WM

name: TheAtlantic
text: Maryland Governor Larry Hogan wants to be the face of a kinder, gentler Republican Party. Does the Republican Party want that? @mckaycoppins reports: https://t.co/R78LxZLLCU

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @JohnGHendy: "Parties can change. But it will require a lot more than a single Republican speaking out." https://t.co/s2D5cs1aV6 via @mckaycoppins

name: TheAtlantic
text: The pandemic could push the U.S. population to its lowest growth rate in 100 years, writes @jpinsk: https://t.co/5H468m6N9v

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @TheAtlantic: 1/ "This is the Johnsonian view of the world: a romantic, egocentric belief in his personal power to do great things, to solve great puzzles, through the force of his personality."

https://t.co/G4QOI3OmKq

Let’s look back at the prime minister's tumultuous first year in office:

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The chaos in Portland is not an accident. The chaos is the point," @anneapplebaum argues: https://t.co/lksVcrUbzt

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @jpinsk: What will the pandemic do to America's population?

My latest in @TheAtlantic has some educated guesses:

https://t.co/I3xawTwjTx

name: TheAtlantic
text: Astronomers have captured an image of two giant planets around a sunlike star, and the view is eerily similar to our own spot in the cosmos, @marinakoren reports https://t.co/ks7YiqhyoR
